summary: Michael C. Eberhardt was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents list his name, position, and salary during that period. The documents suggest he was a staff member of the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Michael C. Eberhardt's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, indicating his involvement in the official investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll and certification reports confirms his participation in the committee's work.
